title: ABySS vs. Velvet
body: Throughly compare Velvet/VelvetOptimizer contigs with ABySS contigs using timing information, RAM usage information, and N50 scores for optimized contigs.

title: Non-contig reads tracking
body: Keep track of reads which were not used in contigs in a separate file.

title: Proper logging
body: Update logging process to perform everything commented in Rake file.

title: Demonstrate importance of Kmer optimization
body: Demonstrate importance of Kmer optimization by creating a histrogram comparison of best N50 vs. worst N50.

title: GO/COG processing
body: Determine if GO and COG functionality of MEGAN is pertinent.

title: Winscore
body: Better test WinScore in MEGAN.

title: Complete visualization
body: Determine process to inject reads into MEGAN from Novoalign or Tophat. Simpliest way to do it is via a CSV file but then can not change LCA parameters.

title: Visualize genome coverage
body: Consider visualizing genome coverage of organism after DeNovo Assembly.

title: Injecting No Hits/Not Assigned
body: Determine if appending No Hits and Not Assigned to all extracted taxonomies would be beneficial.

title: Metagenome alternatives
body:
Execute Phymm and compare results with MEGAN.
Find/create an appropriate database for RAIphy (http://bioinfo.unl.edu/raiphy.php), execute it, and compared results with MEGAN.
Research speed differences between Blast2lca (https://github.com/emepyc/Blast2lca) and MEGAN.

title: Data management
body: Consider adding data to a database.

title: Full automation
body: Add inclusive machine learning or human input process to tune parameters at end of process. Also research executing rake file as a shell script if Rake is not installed to install Rake.

title: ABySS configutation
body: Add maxmimum kmer size detection or force recompilation.

title: Other read type support
body: Research other tools which would allow for support of other read types and incorporate them into PARSES.

title: Modularization
body: Convert to modules instead of specific applications which can be chosen specifically by user or automatically by system specifications, data quality, data type, time limitations, etc.

title: MEGAN extraction
body: Figure out how to use 'extract' reads instead of 'export' reads in MEGAN.

title: GUI
body: Wrap PARSES in a GUI.

title: Manual
body: Create a manual for PARSES.

title: Program link repository
body: Create an online repository with fresh links to all of the underlying tools used in PARSES which can be used in the event that the hard coded links on older versions fail.

title: Data reporting
body:
Add report generation. Consider the following (where _italics_ means it is already being generated):
- _Dataset name_
- _Read Length_
- Quality statistics on reads (example http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8709992/miRcntl_inf1_run1.novo.NM.fastq.stats.quality.png) 
- _Percent of data being culled at each point in the process_
- _Timing information for each portion of PARSES and complete run_
- _Image of taxonomies with default LCA parameters (example like what I liked above or a pie chart of the same)_
- _Arguments used for each program in PARSES_
- _Time of day each data set processed_
- _Error information_
- Image of contig support from ABySS (http://www.bcgsc.ca/platform/bioinfo/software/abyss-explorer/screenshot)
- Image representing amount of data at each portion of PARSES
- Rarefaction curve
- Comparison of taxonomies across data sets (including heat maps, pie charts, bar graph distribution, etc.)
- _Versions of all software and databases used_
- _Data type_
- All files produced by PARSES
- Processor and RAM usage of system
- _Environment information such as total number of CPUs, total mem, etc._
- Dataset description
- Search for similar dataset
- Image depicting entire dataset, including No Hits, Not Assigned, and the host organisms extracted reads as either pie chart or overview.
- _ABySS contig information (coverage threshold, median kmer coverage, Number of kmers assembled, optimum kmer, N50 score)_
- _Percent of reads culled by LCA parameters_
- Pie charts of phylogenetic differniation at different taxonomic levels.
- Percent of data at each taxonomical level given set of LCA parameters.
- Boxplot of variance in selected hit's bitscore versus first hit's bitscore of a different taxonomy than selected hit.
- Pie chart of a taxonomical group's potential other taxonomies based on non-selected hits weighted by bitscore difference.
- _Host organism_
- _Percent of data from host organism_

title: MEGAN auto-registration
body: Automatically register MEGAN.

title: MEGAN reads naming
body: Find a way to programatically name reads extracted from MEGAN with name of original file prepended.

title: Notification system
body: Allow user to configure PARSES to send emails, texts, tweets, system beeps, etc. with the current status.

title: Tune parameters
body:
Perform simulations to determine ideal values of PARSES parameters and identify and tune ideal tunable parameters. 
Parameter list: https://spreadsheets.google.com/ccc?key=0AsvKjyf7k435dFlmMGFfNTI0OWJyUmo5ek1uRE9NTGc&hl=en&authkey=CO-0zsMI

title: Cluster computing
body: Support for MPI.

title: Post-assembly concentration retention
body: Record how many base pairs factor into the construction of a contig and duplicate the contig respectively divided by its length to simulate retention of concentration information.

title: Simple installation
body: Allow for installation of tools and for task listings without having to specify a sequence file, etc.

title: Targeted non-human DNA removal
body: Ability to install and index a database provided and remove DNA from dataset of a specific organism in addition to human.

title: MEGAN 4 support
body: Command-line interaction is completely changing in MEGAN 4.

title: MegaBLAST
body: Determine if MegaBLAST is an appropriate replacement for BLAST+.

title: Galaxy
body: Consider creating a Galaxy version of the pipeline. The Central Galaxy server does not have a de novo assembler so an abbreviated version would have to be created on it, but tools are easy to add to own version. Could fully implement on a local Galaxy server without much effort which would get many benefits such as more data types supported, automatic scheduling, simplified logic, GUI, etc.

title: Progress Bar
body: Considering adding progress bars the pipeline. Especially one for BLAST+.

title: ENV NT and/or WGS
body: Consider using ENV NT and/or WGS in addition to or as a pre-processing step to using NT.

title: BLASTn Replacement
body: Consider replacing BLAST+ with a faster aligner such as BWA or Bowtie.

title: BLASTn Parallel
body: Run multiple instances of BLASTn in parallel with query split into chunks and recombine at the end.

title: Paired-end support
body: Add paired-end support to PARSES.

title: Arbiturary Execution
body: Allow executing PARSES from any point even if previous portions of PARSES has not been run.

title: GPU Versions
body: Support for GPU-centric version of applications including GPU-BLAST.

title: Gi-TaxID Database download/install
body: Add download and installation of gi taxonomy database.

title: Bundle results
body: Bundle results into an archive and clean up files. (Likely better just to use a database)

title: BLASTTAB integration
body: Switch to using BLASTTAB + taxon id injection for performance reasons. Including incorporating No Hits into results.

title: Benchmark PARSES
body: Benchmark with different data sizes on different machines.

title: Pairwise/BLASTTAB option
body: Ability to choose between BLASTn Pairwise or BLASTTAB output formats.

title: LCA parameter examples
body: Produce better LCA parameter examples for documentation.

title: Prevent preferences deletion on error
body: When an error occurs in PARSES the preferences file for the data set is removed. This should not happen.

title: Intelligent scheduler
body:
Create a scheduler which can run multiple data set and stagger different tasks (steps) so that a machine's resources can best be utilized.

Torque (PBS) is an excellent tool for this but is rather complicated.

title: Test Unit
body: Create a test unit for PARSES
